byline.contributor: Kareem Fahim contributed reporting from Cairo.

abstract: United Nations Human Rights Council, answering growing international concerns over civilian casualties, considers resolution to send mission to Yemen to investigate human rights abuses there; both Houthi rebels and Saudi-led coalition opposing them are against UN intervention; Saudi airstrikes are seen as most destructive in terms of collateral loss of life.
lead_paragraph: The Netherlands and some Western countries want the United Nations high commissioner for human rights to investigate abuses in the Yemeni war.

headline.main: Saudis Seek to Fend Off U.N. Inquiry on Yemen
headline.print_headline: Saudis Seek to Fend Off U.N. Inquiry on Yemen

snippet: The Netherlands and some Western countries want the United Nations high commissioner for human rights to investigate abuses in the Yemeni war.

keywords.value: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
keywords.name: subject
